task_description: Facing the building to your East (approx. 82°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the full façade and roofline of the main building ahead (east) to estimate its total height, so I’ll tilt upward to capture the top.
I’m looking north and up, but the target building is to the east, so I should rotate right to face it while keeping the upward pitch to judge roof height.
I’m facing the building but need both the base and roofline in view to estimate height, so I’ll step back to widen the view.
After moving, my view is back to north, so I need to rotate right to face the main building to the east again for the height estimate.
To estimate height reliably I need to see the roofline relative to the ground, so I’ll tilt up to capture the top of the building.
I’m again looking north instead of east, so I should rotate right to 90° while keeping the upward pitch to view the roofline.
I need to provide the height estimate now; the building appears to be about three stories plus a modest roof/parapet, roughly 3.5–4 m per story.
